body.description: Toleriane Purifying Foaming Cream Face Wash and Makeup Remover Product Technology Toleriane Purifying Foaming Cream facial cleanser is a daily face wash for combination to oily skin. This facial cleanser gently cleanses while soothing & removing impurities & makeup from skin. Use morning & evening, massaging into skin in a gentle, circular motion. Rinse thoroughly and pat dry without rubbing. Suitable for: Face, combination to oily skin & sensitive skin Key Ingredients: Glycerin, Sorbitol, La Roche-Posay Thermal Spring Water Dermatologist Tested for Safety* Allergy Tested* Oil-Free/Non Comedogenic* Suitable for Sensitive Skin* Paraben Free* Fragrance Free* Preservative Free* *Confirmed by L'Oréal Active Cosmetics Division, 2020

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About La Roche-Posay Recommended by 90,000 dermatologists worldwide*, La Roche-Posay offers unique daily skincare developed using a strict formulation charter and stringent clinical testing for efficacy and safety, even on sensitive skin. *Survey on the dermocosmetic market carried out by IQVIA and other partners between November 2018 and July 2019 among dermatologists in 46 countries representing more than 80% of the worldwide GDP. Toleriane Purifying Foaming Cream Face Wash and Makeup Remover Product Technology Toleriane Purifying Foaming Cream facial cleanser is a daily face wash for combination to oily skin. This facial cleanser gently cleanses while soothing & removing impurities & makeup from skin. Use morning & evening, massaging into skin in a gentle, circular motion. Rinse thoroughly and pat dry without rubbing. Suitable for: Face, combination to oily skin & sensitive skin Key Ingredients: Glycerin, Sorbitol, La Roche-Posay Thermal Spring Water Dermatologist Tested for Safety* Allergy Tested* Oil-Free/Non Comedogenic* Suitable for Sensitive Skin* Paraben Free* Fragrance Free* Preservative Free* *Confirmed by L'Oréal Active Cosmetics Division, 2020

How to Use Use as a daily cleanser for sensitive skin. Lather face wash in the palm of the hands with lukewarm water. Apply to face using gentle massage movements, avoiding the eye area. Rinse cleanser thoroughly and pat dry without rubbing. Finish up with a mist of La Roche-Posay Thermal Spring Water. Dermatologist Expertise La Roche-Posay is committed to making dermatological skincare accessible to those who need it, by partnering with dermatologists from the development to the recommendation of our skincare products. We are committed to offering highly effective products that can be tolerated by even sensitive skin. What Really Causes Sensitive Skin? Skin has a barrier which acts as a defense against external aggressors and helps lock in essential moisture. Sensitive skin may have a weakened skin barrier, making skin more susceptible to potentially harmful irritants. This can cause signs of skin sensitivity such as dryness, redness, and discomfort. Sensitive Skin Triggers Sensitive skin triggers fall into three categories: 1. Environmental: temperature changes, sun exposure, and pollution. 2. Products with harsh or potentially irritating ingredients: fragrances or alcohol. 3. Internal: stress and lifestyle such as smoking or drinking.

Moisturizes and soothes skin Gently cleanses skin without over-drying Cleanses skin of excess oil, dirt & impurities. Removes face and eye makeup. Mineral-rich micro-droplets provide immediate, intense soothing. This oil-free moisturizer hydrates and soothes sensitive skin. Sunscreen visibly reduces appearance of sun damage. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A MUST have!!!
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this product for a little over a year and absolutely love it. I sometimes have problem skin but less and less when I use the right products. This is a very gentle, unscented foaming cleanser that is very effective and kind to my skin. I used to think that when I was having a breakout I needed to clean my face with harsh....well, anything. There were times I thought that maybe battery acid would be a solution. I have read in many journals that when we over-clean or "strip" our skin the natural healing response is our body producing MORE oils. THIS IS TRUE. With Toleriane I am surprised about a pea sized amount foams very well and lifts any dirt or oil gently and does not rob my face of the necessary balance of natural oils needed for a healthy and clear complexion. My skin feels sooooooooo soft afterwards and creates a great canvas for the skin care products I use. I recently read that the product you use to clean your face should leave your skin feeling soft not dry or tight. This is the product and it is perfect for all skin types. Once you have clean skin, you can apply whatever products you need to correct your own problems if you have any. I am 46 years old but I believe this would also work on younger skin with acne or even older dry skin since it is so gentle. HERE'S the bonus.....I paid about half on line as they charge at the spa. Great product - excellent price:)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works for my sensitive skin and doesn't leave it feeling dry.
reviews.reviewText: This is an allergy safe product for me and I've tried four different face washes the last year since being diagnosed. I also have rosacea and it doesn't annoy that. This is the only one so far that by itself doesn't leave my face feeling dry. It'll be my go-to from now on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful sensitive skin product!
reviews.reviewText: I am not a review writer, but this product impressed me so much that I had to write one!I am in my 20s and have always had really red cheeks. I never did anything about it because my skin broke out occasionally and was combo/oily so I only tackled those issues growing up and into early 20s. Once I discovered my redness was actually rosacea and my skin was extremely sensitive, I have struggled to find products that are "soothing" and "calming" but that aren't thick and goopy or clog my pores. This cleanser is wonderful!I was nervous about the word "Creamy" on the label because that's a bad word for oily/breakout prone skin, but I thought i'd try it anyway. It not only is extremely gentle and calming, but it cleaned my face wonderfully! I wear makeup and I often have to wash twice to remove everything. This cleanser took it all off in one foul swoop! My skin was very clean, but not overly dried out and definitely not irritated!I don't think this cleanser has a smell at all, and I have the nose of a bloodhound. I have had so many medicinal smelling cleansers for "sensitive skin" that make me want to throw up that I am really impressed with this one. Ingredient list is short (which is best) and it delivered exactly what it said it did. It doesn't necessarily "control breakouts" as it is not designed to do that, but it does work great for intolerant skin and it certainly didn't irritate my oily skin or clog my pores in any way. Once every two or three days i'll swipe on a benzoyl peroxide lotion on my breakout prone areas to keep them in check.To be honest, my breakouts are less now with this cleanser than ever before. I don't know if the cleanser is doing that or not, but it's definitely not making them worse! I will be buying this again when I run out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best face wash I’ve used in years
reviews.reviewText: A small amount of soap goes a long way. This isn’t too harsh at all and leaves my skin feeling supple and moisturized. I follow it up with La Roche’s double repair moisturizer or another non comogenic moisturizer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This foams without stripping my skin. My skin does not feel dry afterwards. However, I feel that if I don't remove as much make up from my initial cleanse, it leaves a residual on my face. The good thing is that you need very little amount to make it foam or sudsy so it will last you awhile.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Is it authentic?
reviews.reviewText: The ACTUAL product is amazing, and highly recommended. However, the version sold on amazon changed consistency in less than 4 months to a viscous liquid soap (it should come out more like a cream that you use a pea size and it foams beautifully). Now it barely foams and I need a lot to make it lather. I'm not sure if it's not authentic, or not stored properly, or expired (threw away the box). I would suggest buying at Walgreens, Ulta or La Roche Posey website.It's good for sensitive skin, feels like soap (in that it can be drying, but not irritating), and was appropriate for use with Retin A and acids (BHA, AHA), though I did not try simultaneously with all. It's very good to remove make up and sunscreen. Again, it's a deeper cleanser, so may be too drying for some. My skin is sensitive and it did not cause a reaction. I use a moisturizer after in the months that are too dry or when I am using some other drying acne medication.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent makeup remover
reviews.reviewText: This is my favorite cleanser for my face. It removes all of my makeup and leaves my face clean, as if I had already used an astringent. I have been on a quest to find a good makeup remover for decades, always buying different products, trying to find one that works. My skin does not fall into any category, like oily, dry, etc. My skin seems to have multiple personalities, making it difficult to shop for facial products. This cleanser takes care of my skin no matter what personality it has. I highly recommend this cleanser. La Roche-Posay makes excellent products and I give this cleanser an A+.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best cleanser ever!
reviews.reviewText: Hands down my favorite face wash of all time. I'm on my 3rd bottle and will never stray. This is my holy grail. And it lasts FOREVER. The tiniest amount goes so far. Your face will never feel this clean. I'm talking squeaky clean! A good moisturizer is a must with this as it is a bit drying, but moisturizer is a must no matter what products you're using. I use their Toleraine moisturizer and their Vitamin C serum. And just LOVE this line all around.
Me Alcantar esta marca, es la 3a vez que use este jabón para la cara y me encanta.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only two days but I think it’s holy grail for me
reviews.reviewText: I hesitated for a couple weeks between the Cerave foaming cleanser, the La Roche Posay Effaclar cleanser, and this one. My skin is combination, and I was finding that my cleanser from The Ordinary was leaving my t-zone oily. (Even with double cleansing, oil cleansing, silicone brush..) I am really happy with this cleanser for my combination skin. My t-zone feels clean and not oily, but my face does not feel dry at all. Even just after 2 days, my forehead had reduced redness. I chose this one over the (much cheaper) effaclar because effaclar has some fragrance and has more stripping ingredients. Since my skin is pretty sensitive (and combo) I did not want to risk over stripping, especially on my cheeks. I am really happy with this product. I have no way of knowing if the Effaclar would have met my needs as well (I might try it later on) but I can say that this cleanser seems ideal for my combination, sensitive skin. Highly recommend, it’s really good quality. Also I like the foam because it’s substantial and very light. Makes it easy to work it in without exerting much pressure on the skin. The experience is good as in it feels nice.
Very good cleanser which has good foaming on application

reviews.reviewTitle: 柔らかい細かいあわだ
reviews.reviewText: 泡立ち良く使いやすくて、次もこちらを購入したいなと思います。

I am ABSOLUTLEY in love with this cleanser! I've been using it for several years now, and I've told SO many people about it, that this company should honestly start paying me lol.I have combination skin, so this is especially great for me in summer as it keeps my face matte.Occasionally in winter I get dryer skin, so I tend to switch back and forth between this and Vichy Phytosolution. Its definitely worth the money, I'm 33 and my pores are virtually invisible :D
